SEARCH
Module org.klojang.db
Package org.klojang.jdbc

Class Quoter

java.lang.Object
org.klojang.jdbc.Quoter
public final class Quoter extends Object

Escapes and quotes values according to the target database's quoting and escaping rules. Quoters can be used when executing batch inserts. You don't normally need to concern yourself with quoting and escaping unless you want to tranform a value into a SQL.expression(String) native SQL expression} before saving it to the database. SQL expressions will be injected as-is into the INSERT statement. Klojang JDBC will not attempt to "understand" them. That makes you responsible for protecting yourself against SQL injection. Using a Quoter gives you just as much protection as prepared statements as it completely outsources the quoting and escaping to the JDBC driver.

Here is a clear (but not very useful) example of where and how you can use a Quoter: 


 SQLBatchInsertBuilder builder = SQL.prepareBatchInsert()
    .withTransformer("lastName", (bean, value, quoter) -> {
      String quoted = quoter.escapeAndQuote(value);
      String expression = String.format("LTRIM(%s)", quoted);
      return SQL.expression(expression);
    });
See Also:
  • Statement.enquoteLiteral(String)
  • SQLBatchInsertBuilder.withTransformer(String, Transformer)

  • Method Details

    • escapeAndQuote

      public String escapeAndQuote(Object value) throws SQLException

      Returns a properly escaped and quoted string. This method behaves as follows:

      • if the argument is null, this method returns the string literal "NULL"
      • if the argument is a Number or a Boolean, this method returns value.toString() (in other words, it returns an unquoted string)
      • else this method returns the result of quoting and escaping value.toString() according to the target database's quoting and escaping rules
      Parameters:
      value - the value to quote
      Returns:
      a properly escaped and quoted string
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs
      See Also:
      • Statement.enquoteLiteral(String)
